title: When a car bomb was dismantled after four tense days in Tamil Nadu
description: Killing at least 13 persons, a high intensity bomb blast in a slow moving car near the Red Fort in New Delhi has rocked the country and a terror angle is being probed. About 27 years ago, 60 kg of gelatin explosives planted in an abandoned car at Coimbatore in Tamil Nadu were removed after four nerve-wracking days and detonated.

title: Watch: Modi, Bhutan King gold talks on energy, defence & connectivity
description: Prime Minister Narendra Modi’s two-day visit to Bhutan marks a major step in strengthening India-Bhutan relations. During his talks with King Jigme Khesar Namgyel Wangchuck, the two leaders discussed cooperation in energy, defence, technology, and connectivity. They also inaugurated the 1,020 MW Punatsangchhu-II hydroelectric project, a key symbol of bilateral partnership. Modi’s visit coincides with the 70th birthday celebrations of Bhutan’s Fourth King and highlights India’s continued commitment to its “Neighbourhood First” policy.

Chinese Cryptoqueen caught: UK police seize Bitcoin; scam worth billion exposed
description: A Chinese woman has received an 11-year sentence in the UK for laundering millions embezzled from pensioners. Qian Zhimin, who fled China, used a fake passport to enter the UK and lived lavishly. Police seized one of the world's largest crypto hauls, with the Bitcoin's value soaring significantly since its discovery.

title: Delhi blast: Car was moving, no crater; key reasons agencies think attackers panicked
description: Initial investigations into a car explosion near Delhi's Red Fort suggest it was not a typical suicide attack, but possibly a premature detonation by a panicked suspect. The blast, which killed at least eight people, did not exhibit the usual modus operandi of suicide bombers, with no crater or shrapnel found.

1st Test: From Gill to Bumrah - who did what during first Kolkata practice session?
description: Shubman Gill spent nearly 90 minutes in the nets as he adjusted back to red-ball cricket after recent white-ball games. Before batting, head coach Gautam Gambhir and assistant coach Sitanshu Kotak spoke with him near the High Court end, news agency PTI reported. Among the fast bowlers, only Jasprit Bumrah bowled.

Rs 23.75cr too high': KKR questioned for Venkatesh Iyer decision
description: Former Australian captain Aaron Finch advises Kolkata Knight Riders to reconsider Venkatesh Iyer's hefty Rs 23.75 crore retention. Finch believes Iyer's current middle-order role, without bowling, doesn't justify the price, despite past match-winning performances. He suggests releasing Iyer to free up funds and potentially reacquiring him at a more balanced cost.

description: Exit polls indicate a strong win for the NDA in the Bihar elections. The alliance is expected to secure a majority of seats. The RJD-led Mahagathbandhan is projected to fall short. High voter turnout was recorded in both phases of the polling. The results will shape the political landscape of Bihar.

Will Smith watches in shock as Sharks’ Macklin Celebrini injured, loses teeth
description: During the game against the Anaheim Ducks, San Jose Sharks rookie Macklin Celebrini hurt his face badly and lost a few teeth. Will Smith, a teammate, saw the whole thing happen and his shocked reaction went viral. Even though it hurt, Celebrini's toughness and quick return to the bench showed how dedicated he was to the game.

description: Security forces engaged Maoists in Bijapur district. Six rebels were killed. Weapons and explosives were recovered. One Maoist was taken into custody. This operation marks a significant gain for security forces. The Chief Minister praised the personnel. The campaign against Naxalism continues.

Retired headmaster detained for controversial post on Delhi blast
description: Police have detained Nazrul Islam Borbhuiya, a retired headmaster from Silchar. He posted a controversial comment on social media following the Delhi blast. The post read 'Election is coming'. Authorities are investigating the intent behind the comment. This incident shows increased scrutiny on social media posts about national events. Police aim to stop provocative narratives.

Vicky Kaushal believes ‘good sex is more important than good conversation’: ‘Baatein toh hoti rahengi’
Tracking terror: Car parked near Red Fort for 3 hrs; was there another target?
description: A Hyundai i20 exploded near Delhi's Red Fort, killing at least eight and injuring many. Investigators are tracing the car's 11-hour journey from Faridabad, suspecting a terror attack linked to a wider module. A Pulwama doctor is believed to be the lone, masked driver, possibly a fidayeen attacker. The NIA is now leading the probe.

title: Vibe coding: Meta’s AI chief has advice for teens: Says they should spend time on..
description: Meta's Chief AI Officer, Alexandr Wang, urges teenagers to master AI tools, comparing the current era to the dawn of personal computing. He advises dedicating thousands of hours to 'vibe-coding'—hands-on experimentation with AI—to gain a significant advantage in the future economy. This approach emphasizes rapid learning through prompting and refining AI outputs.

title: ‘Report GPS spoofing within 10 minutes of occurrence:’ DGCA to pilots, ATC
description: DGCA mandates pilots and air traffic controllers to report GPS spoofing within 10 minutes of detection. This new protocol follows unprecedented GPS anomalies at Delhi Airport, where aircraft have experienced incorrect location data and false terrain warnings. The National Security Advisor's office is investigating the issue, which has been common in conflict zones but is a first for Delhi.

title: HR sent termination notice by mistake: 300 employees panicked; career lessons from chaos
description: An HR team's accidental test of an offboarding tool sent an email to all 300 employees stating their employment was terminated immediately. Chaos ensued as employees questioned the message, but IT quickly clarified it was a glitch. The incident highlighted the importance of automation oversight and the power of humor in crisis.

title: Delhi blast: First lead to terror plot came from Jaish posters in J&K; attack in works for 2 yrs?
‘Don’t have notifications’: JPMorgan chief ignores most texts; keeps phone off at work
description: JPMorgan Chase CEO Jamie Dimon, despite leading a massive bank, limits his phone use at work, turning off notifications and ignoring texts unless from his children. He prioritizes focus in meetings, believing distractions hinder engagement. Dimon also advocates for US schools to evolve, integrating crucial skills like coding and cybersecurity to prepare students for the modern workforce.
